title: Tom Golisano
deleted: In March 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic Golisano urged people to keep going to work by saying, “The damages of keeping the economy closed as it is could be worse than losing a few more people,”.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/world/united-states/coronavirus-billionaires-want-people-back-to-work-but-their-employees-arent-so|title=Coronavirus: Billionaires want people back to work, but their employees aren't so sure|last=hermesauto|date=2020-03-26|website=The Straits Times|language=en|access-date=2020-03-27}}</ref> Two days after he clarified his comments with the following statement “I DO NOT advise that people go back to work now. I echo New York Governor Andrew Cuomo’s stance on this – that we need to proceed with caution now and abide by the recommendation of health officials. I did not and would never suggest that anyone risk their life and go against the recommendations of medical experts and health officials and go back to work before it is advisable.”.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://13wham.com/news/local/golisano-clarifies-comments-in-bloomberg-report-says-workers-should-stay-home|title=Golisano clarifies comments in Bloomberg report, says workers should stay home|last=WHAM|date=2020-03-26|website=WHAM|access-date=2020-03-27}}</ref>

title: Tom Golisano
added: In April 2017, Golisano and the Golisano Foundation pledged $3 million to construct a facility dedicated to providing services to families of autistic children in the city of Rochester.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Peace |first1=Lauren |title=How a group of local moms created an autism support system for thousands |url=https://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/local/communities/2018/05/25/mothers-love-how-group-local-moms-created-autism-support-system-thousands/557062002/ |accessdate=14 November 2020 |publisher=Democrat & Chronicle |date=13 November 2020}}</ref>

title: Tom Golisano
added: In April 2017, Golisano and the Golisano Foundation pledged $3 million to construct a facility dedicated to providing services to families of autistic childrenand adultsin the city of Rochester.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Peace |first1=Lauren |title=How a group of local moms created an autism support system for thousands |url=https://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/local/communities/2018/05/25/mothers-love-how-group-local-moms-created-autism-support-system-thousands/557062002/ |accessdate=14 November 2020 |publisher=Democrat & Chronicle |date=13 November 2020}}</ref> The Golisano Autism Center, which opened in September 2019 in a new 33,000 sq. ft. building, is unique in how it integrated numerous recreational, medical and educational support providers and services into one location.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Delbel |first1=Antoinette |title=Golisano Autism Center, hub for autism services, celebrates grand opening |url=https://13wham.com/news/local/golisano-autism-center-celebrates-grand-opening-hub-for-autism-services |accessdate=14 November 2020 |publisher=WHAM 13 |date=12 September 2019}}</ref>
